great

This is it. Al is the best. Modpo is more than a course, it's an international poetry salon on a mission.

Al is one of a kind. I was amazed at the extent to which the course was an emotional experience and not merely an intellectual one. One  senses a personal relationship with Al and the TA's even if you are thousands of miles away on a different continent. I would   love to meet them.
Wonderful professor.  Spent inordinate amount of time teaching this course.  Learned more in this course than in any other humanities course I have ever taken.

I really enjoyed the video sessions by Prof Al Filreis. He had a unique style which made learning such fun and at the same time one think deeply over issues that were universal.He is an inspiring teacher with a natural flair for skilled classroom presentations.

I did not imagine that an online course in poetry could be so compelling and involving for students.  Al reached out through forums, videos, weekly call-in programs, etc to let every student be engaged in poetry.  His passion for modern poetry was contagious!

Al did what I would not have thought possible: created an online environment where he was able to convey his knowledge and his passion for poetry to a huge audience. He did it through enthusiasm and commitment. His level of engagement was incredible. Anywhere you went in the discussion forums, Al was there. He's STILL there; and so are we.

Professor Al Filreis is both passionate and well versed in poetry. Areas of study as subjective and often abstract as this one require just such a teacher. In the on-line course, I was impressed by his commitment to reaching out to the 30,000+ students. He constantly appeared on numerous threads numerous times. Al gave us a key to  all poetry.

Al is very involved in the day activities of the class.  He was involved daily in discussion board and our FB Modpo group discussions.  I found myself immersed in the material presented in the class and the lessons and insights gleaned from Modpo have carried over into my day to day life.

Al Filreis made the course of Modern and Contemporary American Poetry incredibly interesting. What is very valuable in the work of Professor Filreis is that he tries not to leave without the answer any question, what could seem impossible in MOOCs.

He helps one see poets and writers in a new light as if they had been partially hidden in chiaroscuro until then. He expounds his ideas in socratic fashion, so that one comes to understand what one otherwise may have missed about their worth. Most of all he helps one feel they can be part of what literature is all about.
Great course. Fabulous professor. Awesome TAs.

He provided a challenging and satisfying overview of modern and contemporary American poetry.  His use of a roundtable discussion rather than lecture format provided an high-interest learning environment.

I took the inaugural Coursera MOOC for UPenn's English 88 called Modern and Contemporary Poetry with students from all over the world.  Prof Filreis taught me how to read a poem and made the process relevant to my life to the point that I plan to be his student forever.  He is fantastic and demanding (and deserving) of one's best efforts.

Excellent class. Al Filreis is an excellent teacher who seems be able draw your interaction even though you are 3,000 miles away taking this online course. He has really added to my poetry experience. Take this online class (Modern&Cont Amer Poetry) through Coursera next Sept (2013).
His enthusiasm and interaction with the students MADE the class! What a wonderful, engaging, and terrific course this was on Modern and Contemporary Poetry!

Al Filreis is truly one of the finest teachers I have encountered at any level from kindergarten through graduate school: scholarly but down-to-earth, pedagogically expert, creative, witty, warm, congenial, helpful, generous of his time and spirit. Professor Shams! I took two courses with you, one in fall 2017 and one spring 2018. You have been a great source of inspiration in my life at Penn. LOVE Dr. P. This guy is so dedicated to his craft and only wants you to do well. Put in the work and you will walk away from his classes an expert, but don't expect it to come easy. Get as much face time with Dr. P as you can. Dr. P is great - he is very thorough, responds to emails quickly, always available to meet. His explanations are very easy to understand. Dr. P was extremely helpful and is invested in his student's success.  His lectures were well organized, interesting, and above all, informative.  He is an excellent teacher.
Very Smart guy. He teaches chemistry his way and doesn't rely on book at all.
